TopicTitle: Does retracting your landing gear reduce atmospheric drag?

Articles.Content: The wiki doesn't say much about it. I've never noticed a difference, but it might just be too subtle for me to see.
It depends on the part. Some of them (usually mod parts) have different drag values deployed and retracted.
I have noticed that they do, of only slightly. I use MechJeb to see where I'm going to land and extending and retracting the landing gear changes the prediction by a few km.
ya the ksp aerodynamics model is about as realistic as Hollywood's physics.
I do it anyway, just for the looks. It's like putting nosecones on your boosters. (Regardless of the stability thing)
